page.title: 07THE PHEASANTRY AT HACKWOOD
page.content: Hackwood Copse is near Trinley Farm. There are 4/5 pheasantries in the Copse. The raising of the pheasants gives {EMPLOYMENT} to Ron Holdway and Paul Jenkins.They look after and rear the pheasants. Pheasantry {FARMING}is very popular in this area because people are invited to the farm for { {RECREATION}shooting. Only the males (cocks)are shot. The hens are not shot Mr.Holdway rears 5,000 pheasants a year. First the eggs are put in an incubator.When they hatch they are put into the special pens. When they are bigger they have rings put through their beaks to stop them eating each other. While they are in pens they are fed a special food. Then they go into the open pens in the woods so if they want to fly off they can. This happens every year. Some of the pheasants are born in the wild.
